page.title: 03TRANSPORT IN MIDDLETON
page.content: Middleton is situated six miles north-east of Manchester and about the same distance south-west of Rochdale on the A664 road. Middleton junction station a mile out of the centre towards Oldham provides rail links with Rochdale and Manchester. The Rochdale Canal passes through the town but this is no longer serviceable, being officially closed to navigation in 1952.In places it is now culverted. The M62 motorway linking Lancs. with Yorks passes through the area, and there is a service area at Birch. A modern bus terminal provides regular services to Manchester and surrounding towns.Local buses also link fringe housing developments with the town centre.
